Violation Type: Failure to report contagious diseases among workers
Workers with open wounds not properly covered

Failure to maintain personal cleanliness (hair, nails, etc.)
Failure to wear clean work attire, gloves, or head coverings
Failure to provide valid health cards for workers
Receiving, using, displaying, or selling food from unapproved sources or produced in unauthorized manners
Using prohibited or non-compliant materials in food production, or exceeding permissible limits for flavors, colors, or preservatives

Failure to transfer food to the designated storage area immediately after receipt

Incorrect thawing of food and refreezing meals multiple times

Improper handling and presentation of food, equipment, or utensils
Food preparation outside the designated premises or during maintenance
Processing or manufacturing pork and its derivatives inside the establishment, or failing to separate pork and its equipment from other products (for authorized establishments only)

Lack of temperature measuring devices and temperature recording logs

Leaving perishable food at unsafe temperatures for more than 4 hours or storing cooked food for more than 48 hours
Storing food in containers previously used for hazardous or toxic substances
Placing food in uncovered containers exposed to contamination
Storing food directly on the floor without shelves or platforms
Failure to maintain cleanliness of food items on shelves and improper cleaning of storage shelves
Failure to remove or withdraw unfit food products
Storing food in containers previously used for hazardous or toxic substances
Failure to provide equipment and tools that meet specifications and activity requirements
Equipment and tools are made of unsuitable materials, improperly installed, or difficult to maintain
Using unclean, broken, or improperly stored utensils and equipment that are not suitable for the activity
Using unclean or improperly stored towels and disposable containers
Water tanks, plumbing, and filters are unsuitable or do not meet specifications
Placing newspapers or cardboard on shelves or inside refrigerators
Improper installation or placement of gas cylinders
Storage area is unclean, damp, disorganized, too small, or lacks platforms and shelves
Storing food with non-food items that negatively affect it, such as detergents and pesticides

Storing different types of food together improperly
Storing or keeping fruits and vegetables in unsuitable crates
Selling or providing unfit or spoiled food
Selling or displaying expired food
Selling or serving food contaminated with insects, solid residues, or chemicals

Violation Type: Selling or displaying adulterated food
Additional Action: Confiscation + Closure for up to 1 week

Selling or using bulging canned food, or food showing leakage or rust

Reusing leftover food
